title: Irén Marik
text:
Irén Marik (1905 - 1986) was a classical <a href="pianist">pianist</a> born in <a href="Hungary">Hungary</a>.
Although she studied with composer <a href="B%C3%A9la%20Bart%C3%B3k">Béla Bartók</a> and studied at Budapest's <a href="Liszt%20Academy">Liszt Academy</a>, she fled Hungary after World War II and moved to the United States, where she taught at <a href="Sweet%20Briar%20College">Sweet Briar College</a> and eventually moved to the small town of <a href="Independence%2C%20California">Independence, California</a>, outside of <a href="Death%20Valley">Death Valley</a>, where she lived with author <a href="Evelyn%20Eaton">Evelyn Eaton</a>.
She taught piano there and occasionally recorded in studios, but for the most part gave performances in her desert home for her neighbors and friends. Irén Marik died in 1986.
